name: Common Hollyhock
climate: Common Hollyhocks thrive in temperate climates with warm summers.
They can tolerate a variety of climates from maritime to continental.
Prefer environments without extreme humidity or arid conditions.
Generally flourish in USDA hardiness zones 3 through 8.
sunlight: Full sun exposure is essential for optimal blooming of hollyhocks.
They can grow in partial sun but may produce fewer flowers.
Aim for at least six hours of direct sunlight daily for best results.
Ensure they are not shaded by taller plants or structures.
watering: Regular watering is essential, especially in dry spells for hollyhocks.
Avoid overwatering; soil should be moist but not waterlogged.
Once established, they need moderate moisture to thrive properly.
Ensure good drainage to prevent root rot due to excess water.
soil: Hollyhocks prefer well-drained soil rich in organic matter.
Soils should retain some moisture but allow excess to escape.
They perform best in slightly acidic to neutral pH soil conditions.
Loamy or sandy soils are ideal, facilitating healthy root growth.
extra_care_tip: Stake tall hollyhocks to provide support against wind damage.
Watch for rust, a common fungal disease, and treat as necessary.
